title: How much Trump's Secret Service travel could be costing
description: CNN's Tom Foreman breaks down some of President Donald Trump's travel expenses, honing in the on cost of secret service while traveling to Trump's different resorts.

title: Beachcomber thought she found a plate. Months later, she learned it was a land mine
description: Back in April, Jayne Wilson found what she thought was an old plate lying on the beach. The truth is a bit more explosive.

title: Origin of mystery humming noises heard around the world uncovered
description: In 2018, a multitude of seismic signals were detected by earthquake monitoring agencies all over the world in May and June. They created a weird humming sound and some of the signals detected in November of that year had a duration of up to 20 minutes.

title: Best way to pack a carry on bag
description: Samantha Brown has been crossing the globe as a TV travel host for 20 years. She often just takes a carry on bag, and offers her best tips for packing up your luggage. First tip: go with a hardside suitcase

title: How Pompeo convinced Trump to kill Soleimani
description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo was a driving force behind President Donald Trump's decision to kill a top Iranian general, sources inside and around the administration tell CNN, a high-stakes move that demonstrates Pompeo's status as the most influential national security official in the Trump administration.

title: Megyn Kelly tears up watching 'Bombshell' film
description: Megyn Kelly has shared her reaction to the film "Bombshell," which depicts Roger Ailes' downfall at Fox News. Charlize Theron portrays Kelly in the film.

title: Beyoncé teases new Adidas collaboration
description: Beyoncé Knowles-Carter is kicking off 2020 by giving fans a fresh glimpse of what they can expect from her highly-anticipated Ivy Park x Adidas collection ahead of its release later this month.

title: A huge meteorite smashed into Earth nearly 800,000 years ago. We may have finally found the crater
description: One of the largest known meteorites to hit Earth struck nearly 800,000 years ago, but the exact spot where it smashed into our planet has been a mystery -- until now.

title: Meghan and Harry waxworks removed from Royal family display at Madame Tussauds
description: London's Madame Tussauds museum has announced that it has removed the waxworks of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex from its Royal Family set.

title: Husband says wife was worried about plane before it crashed
description: Hassan Shadkhoo says he reassured his wife that everything would be fine before she took off on Flight PS752, which fatally crashed minutes after takeoff from Tehran to Kiev.

title: Facebook says it's 'not deaf' to criticism. But it will still let politicians lie in ads
description: Facebook said Thursday that it was "not deaf" to criticism of its policy allowing politicians to spread lies on its platform. But it will not change its rules.

title: Here's what was happening inside the Situation Room as Trump decided his response to Iran
2020 could be a defining year for the cannabis industry
description: 2019 was a momentous year for the cannabis industry: Hemp-derived CBD had a heyday, Illinois made history, California got sticky, vapes were flung into flux, and North American cannabis companies received some harsh wake-up calls.

title: US soccer star Sergino Dest leaves Ajax's Qatar training camp amid Iran tensions
description: Ajax youngster Sergino Dest has left the club's winter training camp in Qatar amid political tensions between the US and Iran.

title: The British press has gone wild with Meghan and Harry's shock announcement
description:
• Harry and Meghan trademarked their brand 
• How they may become financially independent
• Couple get royally mocked by Late-night

title: Ukraine is investigating multiple possible causes of the deadly Tehran plane crash that killed 176 people
description:
• Plane changed directions before crash
• Passenger had premonition plane would crash, husband says

title: 10 young athletes to watch in 2020
description: New year, new sporting thrills to savor.

title: Art duo Pierre et Gilles have spent 40 years creating opulent shrines to pop icons
description: Back in the 1990s, Michael Jackson phoned French photographer Pierre Commoy and painter Gilles Blanchard -- better known as Pierre et Gilles -- to place an order for 70 portraits.

title: Trump vs. Iran: It's not over
description: Though President Donald Trump's showdown with Iran mercifully ended short of a full-blown war, the near miss did nothing to defuse a confrontation almost certain to boil up again soon.

title: Internet shutdowns cost the global economy $8 billion last year, report says
description: More than 18,000 hours of internet shutdowns around the world caused by deliberate government action cost more than $8 billion in 2019, a new report estimates.

title: Here's what happened inside the Situation Room as Trump decided his response to Iran
description:
• Live updates: US lawmakers are furious about the Trump administration's Iran briefing
• Analysis: Iran's unconventional arsenal a tough match for US

title: Extreme E the 'future of off-road racing'
description: When Alejandro Agag first touted the idea of Formula E to his close friend and Formula 1's long-time puppet master Bernie Ecclestone, he was bluntly told he was destined for failure.

title: World's worst measles epidemic kills 6,000 people in Democratic Republic of Congo
description: Measles has killed more than 6,000 people in the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC), the World Health Organization has said.

title: A new virus related to SARS is the culprit in China's mysterious pneumonia outbreak, scientists say
description: A mysterious pneumonia outbreak that has struck dozens of people and put China on edge is from the same family of viruses as the deadly severe acute respiratory syndrome (SARS), according to Chinese scientists.

title: Ex-Nissan CEO says Carlos Ghosn's escape from Japan is a betrayal
A billionaire is giving away $9 million to his Twitter followers in an experiment to see if the money makes them happier
description: A Japanese billionaire will give away more than $9 million to 1,000 people on Twitter to see if it improves their happiness. All they had to do to get it was retweet him.

title: GOP rebellion breaks out on Iran as Senate inches toward impeachment
Australian mining magnate pledges $48 million to fire relief
Justin Bieber reveals he's battling Lyme disease
description: Justin Bieber has revealed he was recently diagnosed with Lyme disease, an infection caused by bacteria commonly carried by ticks.

title: Riddles on ancient Viking monument may signal fears of cold climate crisis, study says
description: A huge 9th-century stone monument in Sweden may have been erected by Vikings who feared a repeat of a cold climate crisis that took place more than 300 years earlier, according to a new study.

title: Republican rebellion breaks out on Iran as Senate inches toward impeachment
description: A President impeached at home and using lethal force abroad. Threats of a nuclear program in the Middle East, questions about an international coalition and a Gulf War in the not-so distant memory.

title: Iraqis react to US-Iran tensions: Leave this country in peace
description: After decades of an enduring cycle of violence, Iraqis are hardened to conflict. But many say they have little vested interest in the latest tit-for-tat between the US and Iran. CNN's Jomana Karadsheh reports from Baghdad.

title: Europe's kingdom of fairytale castles
description: Many modern visitors to Denmark are drawn by its groundbreaking Nordic cuisine, beautiful design, clean cities, windswept coastline or its cycle network -- all of which help make it one of the happiest countries on Earth.

title: Woman had premonition her plane would crash in Iran, husband says
description: Twenty minutes before the plane took off from the Iranian capital, Sheyda Shadkhoo called her husband from aboard the flight. She wanted him to reassure her that everything would be fine, he said.

title: See dog's transformation after new fitness journey
description: A dog named Pearl experienced an incredible weight loss journey when she began water therapy workouts. CNN affiliate KTMF has the story.

title: Drinking green tea, rather than black, may help you live longer, new study suggests
description: Drinking tea at least three times a week could reduce the risk of dying from cardiovascular disease and is linked with a longer and healthier life, at least in China, a new study suggests.

title: Pregnant teacher loses unborn child in a crash 30 minutes after her baby shower
description: Mashayla Harper was nearly killed on her way home from her baby shower after what police say was a hit-and-run. Her unborn child didn't survive.

title: These are the claims Trump got wrong about Obama and Iran
description: CNN's Daniel Dale fact-checks some of the misleading statements and falsehoods President Donald Trump made about Iran and former President Barack Obama in his speech following Iran's attack on the Iraqi air base that housed US troops.

title: Appeals court allows use of $3.6 billion in military funds for border wall
description: A federal appeals court allowed the administration to use a certain set of Defense Department funds for the construction of the border wall after a lower court blocked the administration from dipping into them last month.

title: Owner says bulldog was crushed to death at PetSmart during grooming visit
description: A woman in Las Vegas took her dog to PetSmart after Christmas for a grooming. Thirteen minutes later, the bulldog was dead, crushed under the weight of the grooming table, its owner said.

title: Ukraine lawmakers mysteriously delete message about cause of crash
description: Ukraine leaders change their response that "terrorism was not involved" after a Ukrainian plane crash in Iran kills 176 victims. CNN's Tom Foreman reports.

title: Red 'devil horns' has internet freaking out
description: Devil horns or bikini top? What do you see in eclipse photos? CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: GOP senator: That briefing was insulting
description: Sen. Mike Lee (R-UT) rails against a classified briefing on Iran, calling it "the worst briefing I've seen, at least on a military issue."

title: Satellite images appear to show damage from Iranian missile strikes
description: Daylight and satellite images appear to show the aftermath of Iranian missile strikes at an Iraqi military base that houses US troops.
